= Http Configuration

This config section convert environment variable related to http configuration to valid odoo CLI.

include::partial$converters/http.adoc[]


[[option_http_enable]]
== http_enable
Disable the HTTP and Longpolling services entirely

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 12.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `HTTP_ENABLE` is used and expect a xref:ROOT:type_var.adoc#env_var_value_type_bool[bool].

Odoo cli used:

* --no-http

[[option_http_interface]]
== http_interface
Listen interface address for HTTP services. Keep empty to listen on all interfaces (0.0.0.0)

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 12.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `HTTP_INTERFACE` is used and expect a xref:ROOT:type_var.adoc#env_var_value_type_str[str].

Odoo cli used:

* --http-interface

[[option_http_port]]
== http_port
Listen port for the main HTTP service. Keep empty to listen on all interfaces (0.0.0.0)

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 12.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `HTTP_PORT` is used and expect a xref:ROOT:type_var.adoc#env_var_value_type_int[int].

Odoo cli used:

* --http-port

[[option_proxy_mode]]
== proxy_mode
Activate reverse proxy WSGI wrappers (headers rewriting).
        Only enable this when running behind a trusted web proxy!

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 12.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `PROXY_MODE` is used and expect a xref:ROOT:type_var.adoc#env_var_value_type_bool[bool].

Odoo cli used:

* --proxy-mode

[[option_x_sendfile]]
== x_sendfile
Activate X-Sendfile (apache) and X-Accel-Redirect (nginx)
        HTTP response header to delegate the delivery of large
        files (assets/attachments) to the web server.

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 16.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `X_SENDFILE` is used and expect a xref:ROOT:type_var.adoc#env_var_value_type_bool[bool].

Odoo cli used:

* --x-sendfile



== Other environment keys



[[env_HTTP_ENABLE]]
=== HTTP_ENABLE
Convert environ key=HTTP_ENABLE

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 12.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `HTTP_ENABLE` is used and expect a `bool`.

NOTE: No cli argument exist for this key
